page.title: 04Ormskirk ghosts
page.content: The Devil's Wall, as its name suggests, has long been associated with mysterious happenings. One recent story tells of two men camping on this spot. After their second night, people walking past saw their tent ripped and torn, but police found no sign of the men, then or later. Another story perhaps reflects the Civil War battle fought there. A friend's father was walking at night when he saw a headless knight on a white horse. It vanished into the darkness. There are two other stories - one tells of two large stones which have water on them each morning, more than can be accounted for by dew - the devil's washing bowl. The devil is also blamed for the smashed crockery constantly appearing on the path.
